reviews.text: The beef empanada, trancapecho, and cilantro fries are all delicious. Everything is full of flavor and perfectly cooked. Highly recommend this place if you‚Äôre looking for authentic and tasty Bolivian food!
Love this spot! Great chicken sandwiches! The saltenas are amazing! Staff is always cool and friendly.
Valentina was super nice and helpful. The food was delicious!! We had a thoroughly great time and highly recommend
Soooo good! Great vegan options, but also brisket was 10/10!
Top-tier food, but shrinkflation hit this place hard.

I order delivery here far too often... Quality is outstanding. Would recommend to any Sunnysider or visitor looking for a delicious salte√±a or some bangin' chicken dishes. One of my favorite spots in the neighborhood. All hail the llama!
The saltenas are one of the best empanadas I ever tasted ! Definitely worth a taste! Also, their Bolivian dishes.
If you ever want to try Bolivian food, you definitely need to come here. The best salte√±as and sandwiches, highly recommend this place to anyone !
Amazing food will definitely come back. Valentina helped me find what to order great service
Valentina was very kind and helped me pick out the menu. The food was amazing. The chicken is insanely juicy. One of the best chicken sandwiches I‚Äôve ever had
Awesome food! Very nice people. Definitely coming back again!
Amazing place and people! Thank you again Valentina!

The food here is absolutely delicious! I‚Äôve been coming for months, and the portions are generous with unique, flavorful dishes. The only downside is the limited seating, just a few outdoor seats. It‚Äôs perfect when the weather‚Äôs nice, but in the winter, takeout is probably the way to go. Overall, such an amazing and tasty spot!
Best salte√±as!!!

The chicken and beef salte√±as from Bolivian Llama Party are absolutely amazing! The filling is rich, flavorful, and bursting with that signature Bolivian spice and juiciness. You can really taste the quality ingredients and the care that goes into making them. Me and my friend really enjoy eating at this place definitely recommend!
Love the place! Always amazing Bolivian food. Would frequent more often if they have an indoors place to sit.
Great variety of amazingly cooked food and service is always quick
BLP is consistently the best option!!
The souuuup!!!
LLAMA PARTY!!!
Great food! my go to comfort food :)
the sopa de man√≠ changed my life
Food is amazing and th vibe is always a party!
Food was great and the service :)

Amazing!!
One of my favorites.
Best Bolivian Food in Queens!
LOVE the sopa de mani
Amazing food and atmosphere. 100% coming back again.
Great food only. 10-15 wait time for food
love their cala brisket bowl üòéüòé
Amazing beef heart
Nice and friendly place

The salte√±as were of middling quality. I happen to be from Bolivia and I must say that these salte√±as did not live up to my expectations for not only the price that I paid for them ($81 for a dozen), but also the fact that the taste and texture were completely off. I felt as though the ingredients were inconsistent and muddy, especially the chicken, which I have never in my life seen cut into square cubes in a salte√±a. The chicken itself was largely absent from the flavor, giving me the impression that it was either partially thawed or barely present in the first place. The masa was lacking crunch. I hope this was a fluke, but as someone who misses salte√±as and is often homesick, I was very disappointed. (P.S I think it was too much parsley, and I think there were carrots and peas in it too)

Valentina was amazing
Great service and great food!
The food is AMAZING. Valentina was great! :)
Please please go here. Get the salte√±as, you will be transformed.

Went to the place on the way home from Queens Center.

It was a little hole in the wall. There was only outdoor seating. The service was good. It was a wait for the food because they were busy and the food was fresh.

We got a series of dishes that were good! They definitely were more of a modern style of Bolivian food.

Everything had good flavors and they give you a lot of food!

The jackfruit chola sandwiches we had were fantastic‚Ä¶the description of ‚Äústicky, savory and sweet‚Äù is perfect! And the fries‚Ä¶so crispy and delicious, especially when dipped in the green sauce. Our server was Freddy and he was a delight. Highly recommend BLP!

The Bolivian food here was so good!! I like to sit outside on the sunny day and enjoy the warm soup. Saltenas were so warm, crispy on the outside and full of flavors on the inside. They have some tables on the side walk outside. What a chill place to sit on a chill day.

Bolivian Llama Party üáßüá¥ü¶ô‚ù§Ô∏è So many things to say about this place‚Ä¶ to start, service is always great, people at the counter, and the owners, that sometimes take care of you, are always kind, nice and extremely helpful! Then the food, OMG, best truffle fries you can try in NY, Salte√±as are always a good to go (chicken is my favorite!!), all the bowls are delicious, their chicken sandwiches, veggie choices, everything is amazing there, I am not even vegetarian but I love their jackfruit sandwiches! One of the best places in Sunnyside for sure, I highly recommend trying BLP, they never disappoint! ‚ò∫Ô∏è
Perfect!
This is the place to get Bolivian food that you got to try and man you won't regret it. From saltenas to the chicken sandwich and down it with one of their juice.

THE BEST fried chicken ever. Seriously. And the sauces are amazing. Try the chicken strips with fries, you wont regret it. Also theyre super kind and I love that rubber chicken they use as a ring bell, adds to the charm

This is one of my favorite restaurants. The food is life-changing. Everything I've had on the menu has been a banger.

The service is friendly and quick. Now that they have outdoor seating again, they've cultivated an enjoyable atmosphere to dine in.

The salte√±as are truly mind-blowing. The dough is really tasty and also skillfully made to hold the soup filling. The fried chicken sandwich is one of the tastiest I've had in my life. I love their juices and ice creams as well.

I only wish I knew about this restaurant in time to snag one of the t-shirts they were selling

I was really excited to try this place. I got two of the salte√±as, one chicken one beef.

I mowed down on the chicken first and it was so good,  juicy, nice flavor,  veggies loved it. Then I got into the beef and it was literally the same thing. I could barely tell the difference in the meat. So it was really good,  but I wished I had only gotten one.

Ask the dishes being brought it around new looked amazing. So I'm excited to go back and try something new!
This is the best South American food I have had outside of South America! The staff are friendly and the outdoor seating has a very chill vibe.

The saltenas are a must, if you're going here. It's like a cross between an empanada and a soup dumpling. The juices are really tasty, as well, if a little pricey. But, you can tell their fresh. The storefront is basically a window, with a little outdoor seating provided, and it can be busy at times (esp on the weekends). Well worth the trip, though.
Always high quality and great portions
Comida buenisimo y muy amable servicio.  Flavor a nivel autentica de Bolivia si no mejor üáßüá¥
The best Latin American food experience everrrrr ü•π sandwitch cholo with beef brisket soooo goooood

Customer service here is absolutely awesome ‚Äî full of passion, and you can tell they truly love their food. The food itself is amazing. It was my first time trying Bolivian cuisine and I instantly fell in love with it. The way they cook the chicken is just perfect: crispy on the outside, tender and juicy on the inside. Damn good! Highly recommend this spot!

The truffle fries (Papitas)was the show stopper! They were super crispy and flavorful. Strong truffle flaver! We had both beef and veggies Salte√±as, they were so good, loved the boiled egg inside was a great surprise.

I've been saving this spot on my map for ages, and I feel so satisfied now that I finally got to try it! Sadly, they didn't have much space to sit and dine, and we cycled there so we had the food by the road. However, it was still a great experience, and everything we ordered was so yummy! We will definitely come back for the fries!
One of the best spots in the neighborhood. Everything is delicious, service is fast, and a truly unique menu. I can take anyone there and they can find something they like.
Tasty snacks.  Fries are bomb.  Empanadas are better ( forgive me, I forgot what they‚Äôre called).  Def worth checking out if you like flavor.  And Joslyn was great w service

Originally located in Columbus Circile's underground market, the current location allows for a much more relaxed, livelier atmosphere. Items are ordered at the walk up window with a few benches on the sidewalm for seating. The soupy saltenas burst with flavor, the various bowls, salads are accompanied by crispy seasoned fried. Gonna leave some room for the colorful Llama treatsüòã.
With a name like this, this spot is hard to miss. It's a fun takeout spot with a few seats in the front. The beef saltenas were delightfully crispy on the outside and juicy on the inside.
Loved the chicken sandwich. Pricy but very good. The brisket mac n cheese was disappointing. Very dry and bland. I added some queso to it but yet it didn‚Äôt fill in the dryness.

If you haven‚Äôt been to Bolivia Llama Party yet, definitely check it out. The fried chicken sandwich was so good‚Äîcrispy, flavorful, and just really satisfying without being over the top. I also really liked the beef salte√±a‚Äîit had a comforting, savory filling with a little sweetness that made it stand out.

The matcha juice surprised me in the best way‚Äîit was light, refreshing, and had just the right balance.

Ceilia was so sweet and welcoming‚Äîshe let me try a sample of another juice just because I was curious, which I really appreciated. Little things like that make a difference. Will definitely be back!

After watching a YouTuber's 's perspective from this cheap restaurant. I have decided to try out the best Bolivian salte√±as as the employee Freddy and David were kind enough to provide me with a couple of options.

Passed by BLP so many times and finally got a chance to try it! Freddy made some great recommendations - we got a beef saltena, questo rellenos and the chicha pork bowl.  We love the questo rellenos the most, and their superfruit juices are very interesting combinations of fruits + they‚Äôre not too sweet (highest compliment from a hk-er iykyk)

Very hole in the wall spot, there‚Äôs no indoor seating and you order from a window. They have a few tables and chairs set up outside so perfect on a nice cool day. I loved the Saltenas, it was exactly as advertised. Very much like a soup dumpling crossed with an empanada. The brisket Mac n cheese was good but I wasn‚Äôt blown away by it, I would come back for the Saltenas any day. I also had the Cherimoya drink and I loved it. I‚Äôll definitely be back to try the other drinks as well.

I went there for salte√±as specifically. We had those, and some of their drinks. I really enjoyed everything. My misses said it was good, but she wasn't crazy about it. I'd definitely go back. I would travel far and long, but if I'm in Sunnyside, I'd definitely visit them. Salte√±as that I've had are always slightly sweet. They're good, but I'm not a fan of too much sweetness in my food that's supposed to be savory. These were a little sweeter than usual. I'd still buy them again and enjoy them, but I really wish they were less sweet.

Great place! Authentic Bolivian Salte√±as that I can‚Äôt find anywhere else! Joslyn was great and brought them out to my table. Great atmosphere and made me want to plan another trip to visit family in Bolivia!

essentially only take out but theres tables outside for you to eat, and you have to squeeze a chicken for someone to take your order :) this is the only place with salte√±as around here and they‚Äôre amazing, the sopa de mani and cherimoya drink are great too. you can get a pack of frozen salte√±as to go as well! would love to see some halal ones in the future

Lovely small shop with funky vibe, awesome saltenas(soupy empanadas as they described) , large fried chicken sandwich, wrapped separately with fresh lettuce and pickles, with delectable sauces, and flavored fries, everything os so awesome, and though there is no in store seating but table and chairs set outside on the street with so friendly service
It's a gem of the town!

Love the salte√±as but their rellenos, sandwiches and bowls are really tasty too.

I need to go back for some frozen salte√±as to have at home ready !

This was my first time going to a Bolivian restaurant. I had the Bamba Hot Honey Chicken Sandwich with the Sopa De Mani Soup and the fresh Ginger Tamarind drink, and it was all great. The chicken was super tender yet crunchy on the outside, and the honey sauce had a nice light orange flavor to it. The only thing I didn't realize was that it was a pick up only restaurant. I assumed there was indoor/outdoor seating, so keep that in mind if you are planning to take a date here. Otherwise, the food was very good, and I will be back to try other items on the menu.

Bolivian Llama Party serves up a fantastic, authentic taste of Bolivia right in NYC. The Cala Brisket Bowl was hearty and flavorful, with perfectly tender brisket and a great mix of textures.

The Pork Chola Sandwich was a standout‚Äîjuicy, rich, and packed with flavor, balanced by crisp veggies. The Salte√±as were incredible as well, with their savory, slightly spicy filling and perfectly soft pastry. Every dish was crafted with care and attention to authentic Bolivian flavors.

Highly recommended for anyone craving something unique and satisfying!

If you are in Sunnyside you need to try this place. Loved the service because we asked for suggestions and he recommended everything I loved. We went on a Tuesday around 6pm no wait. There were outdoor seating available and the food came out in 10 min. You have to try the beef Salte√±as with a sweet crust and warm soupy inside. The brisket Mac and cheese was gooey cheese shells with tasty chunks of meat. Chicka Pollo Bowl was tender chicken thighs with quinoa. I am in love with the fresh cilantro green sauce. I would like to be back here again soon to order the same dishes and try new things .

Ok, it's not quite a restaurant, but it is serving up delicious saltenas, which is what we came for. I had the beef, and my friend had the chicken, and both were oozing with soupy goodness. The green sauce took it to a whole other level. I also got the chirimoya juice, which I loved (admittedly, I love anything with chirimoya). If I am ever in Sunnyside again, I would stop by again for sure.

Just note, there are a couple of tables and chairs outside, but not much for seating.

It was very delicious. Does not disappoint. Absolutely amazing beef and chicken salte√±as and peanut soupü§©ü§§. Must come back spot. Followed by a 15 min walk to the Kosciusko bridge to see the sunset üåÖ.

My husband has had Llama party on our must try for awhile and happy we finally tried. We ordered 2 salte√±as, one beef and one chicken. You order at the window. The girl was very nice but didn't make recommendations or ask if we had been there before. The food came out to us and was very hot. The verde sauce on the side was delicious. The salte√±as were fresh and plentiful. The pastry was a bit sweet for my personal liking but the meat and soupyness was hearty. I would definetly come back to try other items. There is only outside seating.

Had heard so much about this place so had to check it out and yes it lives up to the hype!

üçΩÔ∏è Jackfruit carnitas
üçΩÔ∏è crispy papitas with cilantro sauce

Food was so flavorful and really hits the spot. It‚Äôs also vegan/vegetarian friendly . Except for the saltenas consist of beef gelatin but I wish I could try it!
Had a beef and chicken one. Also tried their bread. If you had to pick, pick BEEF! 11/10! Chicken was like a 7/10. Bread was soft and warm, would be great to dip in coffee. The green sauce is fire.
Drove two hours to this place just for their Salte√±as. Did not disappoint!! Incredibly authentic flavor. Bring a cooler for their take home and bake option as well.

I first had Bolivian llama party before I knew Alex (one of the owners), and thought it was one of the best spots in all of Queens. I love to try new food and the fries, salte√±as and bowls were utterly amazing. Since last year, Alex and I have been in contact as he is a business owner connected to the school community I teach in. I have a garden in my classroom that children help grow plants and then we sell those plants to Bolivian llama party in a community partnership. It is an amazing community partnership that is not possible without Alex . Amazing food, amazing people, amazing community. Highly recommend you check out this spot.

Salte√±as smacked. Juicy and filled with meat. Tried their truffle fries as well and were pretty good. Veggie soup was really good as well as a side. Spent about $35 and left full for the entire night. Only outdoor seating or takeout.

Everything was fresh, flavorful, well prepared and EXTREMELY SUPER DELICIOUS!!!   Freddy was so friendly and helpful in taking our order and making suggestions. He made us feel welcome and right at home. The salte√±as are so scrumptious and filled with flavor.  I love how juicy and stewy they are.  French fries are perfectly crispy. The Bros‚Äôter chicken strips are so tender juicy.  The mac and cheese is super tasty. We loved everything!  And the prices are very reasonable. We‚Äôll be back again soon.

Excellent food and service. Salte√±as are nice and soupy, full of flavor. A hearty and comforting food. The chicken sandwich is one of the best in the city, their cilantro mayo is a hidden gem. They need to sell that sauce in jars, unreal. The staff here are so friendly and sweet
The salte√±as were EVERYTHING!!! And the Mac n cheese was SO creamy and delicious! I‚Äôm definitely coming back again!! üôåüèΩ

Hola a todo la comunica de Google Map, chicos!
Bueno, esta vez les quiero hacer mi rese√±a de un este establecimiento de comida tipica Boliviana, esta en Sunnyside, Queens, NYC. Quiero aclarar que no es un Restaurante para comer adentro, ya que cuando llegas a este lugar solamente te atienden por ventanilla, pedis lo que hay en la Carta y esperas que te llamen por tu nombre.
Quiero aclarar tambien que tengo algo de conocimientos de comida tipica Boliviana, por eso hago mi rese√±a con conocimiento de esta rica comida Boliviana. Por lo que pude ver por la ventana, es un establecimiento familiar completamente, por eso cuando vayan para all√°, veran que las comidas son simples y muy ricas.
Por ser primera vez, yo pedi Empanadas Salte√±as Bolivianas de Pollo y Sopa de Mani, todo para llevar. El tiempo de espera para llevar la comida fue dentro de todo lo normal, una demora entre 5 a 9 minutos, eso es bueno. La chica que me atendio fue muy amable y siempre brindando una atencion muy buena.
Una vez que llegue a mi casa, comimos las Empanadas Salte√±as Bolivianas y la Sopa de Mani, realmente fue muy rico y delicioso, les recomiendo que si van por primera vez, pidan Las Empanadas Salte√±as y les aseguro que van a pedir m√°s.....!

Aclaro que hay unas mesas para comer, pero estan en la vedera de la calle.

Hey everyone, the Google Map communication, guys!
Well, this time I want to give you my review of this typical Bolivian food establishment, it is in Sunnyside, Queens, NYC. I want to clarify that it is not a Restaurant to eat inside, since when you arrive at this place they only serve you through the window, you order what is on the menu and you wait for them to call you by your name.
I also want to clarify that I have some knowledge of typical Bolivian food, that is why I am writing my review with knowledge of this delicious Bolivian food. From what I could see through the window, it is a completely family establishment, so when you go there, you will see that the meals are simple and very delicious.
For the first time, I ordered Bolivian Salte√±a Chicken Empanadas and Peanut Soup, all to take away. The waiting time to bring the food was within normal limits, a delay between 5 to 9 minutes, that's good. The girl who helped me was very kind and always provided very good attention.
Once I got home, we ate the Empanadas Salte√±as Bolivianas and the Peanut Soup, it was really very rich and delicious, I recommend that if you go for the first time, order the Empanadas Salte√±as and I assure you that you will order more... ..!

I clarify that there are some tables to eat, but they are on the side of the street.

I really enjoy the food at Bolivian Llama Party, especially the sopa de man√≠, which has a rich, homemade flavor. However, both the soup and the salte√±as have quite a bit of vegetable, which is a bit too much for my taste. I‚Äôd personally prefer the salte√±as with more meat and less veggies.
The best saltenas and papitas!!! Love bringing new friends here ! Always amazing service and food. Thank you Joslyn for your help and sweetness

I almost cried when I bit into the vegan carnitas sandwich... the peanut butter soup is amazing as well. Can't wait to try the other incredible-sounding vegan and vegetarian options here!!! What a gem this place is. Cute outdoor seating (no indoor seating) and very pleasant staff. This place is best for takeout since there are not many tables outside and they're often full.

This place IS fun epitomized! The food is interesting and delicious. The shop is very nice and produces a feeling of happiness. The music is wonderful and uplifting. The team is amazing and incredibly friendly. I left with a giant smile on‚Ä¶

Food was amazing! Had the chicken and beef saltenas. Yum. Loaded Mac and cheese was delish.  Cilantro Papitas were crispy perfection. And Bros‚Äôter Chicken strips were juicy and flavorful. But even better than the food was the service. Freddy was attentive,  made great suggestions and gave us a juice on the house.  Will definitely be back.

Their food was impressive!! My first time having Bolivian food was great because of them!

I really like the bread of saltena. It was well baked, with a thin crispy/ crunchy layer and soft inside that soaked in the soup. It was juicy and the filling was delicious. I personally don‚Äôt like beans but it combined well in it.

I will say overall they do the great job in deep-frying stuff! The rellenos (fried smashed potato balls) were wonderful, and I recommend the cheese one. Fries were good too.

But I vip‚Ä¶ goes to the ice cream!!! I love love love the üíúpurple corn ice cream I got! The flavor was so good with all kinds of spices.
